definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: In my opinion, the number of private cars should be put under control.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，應該控制私家車的數量。

sentences.english: Private cars, like everything else, have more than one face.
sentences.chinese: 像任何事物一樣，私家車也有多面性。

sentences.english: So the private car benefits the growth of economy.
sentences.chinese: 因此，私家車有利於經濟增長。

sentences.english: No adays more and more private cars have entered thousands of ordinary families.
sentences.chinese: 現在越來越多的私家車進入了普通家庭。

sentences.english: But in the past few years private-car ownership has grown rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 但在過去幾年，私家車急劇增加。

sentences.english: With the number of private cars increasing②, traffic jams in metropolitans are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 私家車的增多必然產生大城市交通堵塞。

sentences.english: Does the facility maintain a parking area for private vehicles separate from the shipping . loading dock and cargo areas ?
sentences.chinese: 工廠是否設有私家車停放區並與出貨車停放區分開？

sentences.english: At the same time, we should raise the price of gasoline to a prohibitive level so as to make car-driving expensive enough.
sentences.chinese: 同時，還可以提高油價使得開私家車的代價更高。

sentences.english: Car ownership has increased by 30 per cent since 2002.
sentences.chinese: 2002年以來，私家車的擁有率上漲了30%。

sentences.english: Do I need a permanent resident card if I'm returning to Canada by car?
sentences.chinese: 如果我坐私家車回加拿大，我一定要有楓葉卡的嗎？

sentences.english: Another primary reason is thtoward there seem to be too myoury privingested cars rather not enough public motorcoair conditioning unithses.
sentences.chinese: 另一個主要情由是私家車過多而公交車不夠。
爲私家車做好過冬準備。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Porsche launched its new sedan in China first.
sentences.chinese: 同時，保時捷首次在中國推出其新款私家車。

sentences.english: That's why Angelenos love their private cars more than any other people in the world.
sentences.chinese: 因此，洛杉磯市民比世界上其他人都喜歡私家車。

sentences.english: According to them, private cars have to be limited in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在他們看來，北京必須限制私家車。

sentences.english: What I think is that citizens should be encouraged to take buses instead of driving cars.
sentences.chinese: 我的想法是應該鼓勵市民多坐公車少開私家車。

definition: to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
running in opposite direction (buses, trains, ferries etc)
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
parking spot/unloading point/garage place/stand for taxi
enclosed carriage for carrying passengers/motor carriage/car or bus/limousine/CL:部[bu4],輛|辆[liang4]
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
